subject: Re: [junit] Methods with random numbers
msgSnippet: Do not use Math.random() directly. Instead, hide it behind an interface that provides a method like getNextNumber() . In your tests, substitute an
messageBody:
Do not use Math.random() directly. Instead, hide it behind an interface that provides a method like "getNextNumber()". In your tests, substitute an implementation that answers an expected sequence of numbers. Give this method as good a name as you can think of, given your problem domain.

In the case of a board game, for example, I would hide the randomization behind an interface like DiceRoller with a method rollDice(). Then I could have a deterministic implementation that answers a known sequence of dice rolls and the randomized version that I would use in the real game.

Good luck.

So said sudhir on 3/10/2003 --------------------
Hi

I am trying to write junit test cases for a class.
Some of the functions in the class use random numbers
by calling the function Math.random(). Is there any
way to verify the method.

Thank you

sudhir shakya
